author: Anna Balcells
title: Biden manté el vet a Kíiv per atacar Rússia amb míssils de llarg abast | Anna Balcells | BARCELONA | Política | El Punt Avui
text: GUERRA A EUROPA Biden anuncia més ajuda a Ucraïna però manté el vet a míssils de llarg abast contra Rússia Washington vol evitar una escalada amb Putin, que ha amenaçat de fer ús d’armes nuclears Zelenski presenta al líder dels EUA el seu ‘pla per a la victòria’ Joe Biden ha manifestat aquest dijous el suport dels EUA a Ucraïna “ara i en el futur” durant l’entrevista que ha mantingut amb Volodímir Zelenski a la Casa Blanca, durant la qual el líder ucraïnès tenia previst explicar el seu “pla per a la victòria” al president nord-americà. Zelenski ha acudit a la trobada amb la intenció d’obtenir el llum verd de Biden a la utilització de míssils de llarg abast per colpejar objectius dins del territori rus. Però, abans de l’inici de la reunió, la portaveu de la Casa Blanca Karine Jean-Pierre ja havia descartat que Biden ho autoritzés. El president dels EUA havia anunciat, poc abans de la reunió, l’enviament a Ucraïna de bombes amb capacitat per atacar objectius russos a 130 quilòmetres de distància, com a part d’un nou paquet d’ajuda militar valorat en 8.000 milions de dòlars (uns 7.150 milions d’euros). El nou paquet d’ajuda inclou bombes planejadores JSW, que poden ser llançades des d’avions i arribar amb gran precisió a objectius a 130 quilòmetres. Amb tot, les tropes ucraïneses no podran utilitzar-les dintre de Rússia ja que l’administració de Biden s’hi oposa per por d’una escalada amb Putin, que ja ha advertit que farà ús de les armes nuclears si el seu país és atacat amb armes d’un estat que tingui capacitat atòmica. El nou paquet d’ajuda de Biden servirà per dotar Ucraïna de més sistemes de defensa aèria, sistemes aeris no tripulats i municions aire-terra, i per reforçar la base industrial de defensa ucraïnesa. A més, els EUA formaran l’any que ve 18 pilots ucraïnesos més en l’ús de caces F-16 i lliuraran a Kíiv una bateria addicional de míssils Patriot, i més míssils d’aquest tipus. Poc després d’aquest anunci, Zelenski ha agraït a Biden i al Congrés el nou paquet d’ajuda. author: Noticias
title: El papa Francisco está en «estado crítico» tras una crisis respiratoria, dice el Vaticano
text:
El papa Francisco se encuentra en estado “crítico” y desarrolló una “crisis respiratoria asmática” esta mañana, dijo la oficina de prensa del Vaticano en un comunicado publicado este sábado.
La oficina agregó que, por lo tanto, el papa “no está fuera de peligro” y que “tiene más dolor” que el viernes.
Esta es una noticia en desarrollo y será actualizada.
The-CNN-Wire

author: ABC News
title: Alabama QB Jalen Milroe overcomes doubters, getting 'last laugh' - ABC News
text: Alabama QB Jalen Milroe overcomes doubters, getting 'last laugh' LOS ANGELES -- Just days away from leading [Alabama](http://www.espn.com/college-football/team/_/id/333/alabama-crimson-tide) into the College Football Playoff semifinal against [Michigan](http://www.espn.com/college-football/team/_/id/130/michigan-wolverines), starting quarterback [Jalen Milroe](http://www.espn.com/college-football/player/_/id/4432734/jalen-milroe) said Thursday that former Tide offensive coordinator Bill O'Brien once told him he shouldn't play quarterback. "How would you feel if I told you [that] you suck?" Milroe said of what it was like to receive that remark from his former coordinator. "He told me a bunch of positions I could have switched to, but look where I'm at right now. Who gets the last laugh?" O'Brien, who was the team's offensive coordinator in the previous two seasons, was replaced by Tommy Rees this past offseason after O'Brien left to become offensive coordinator with the NFL's [New England Patriots](https://www.espn.com/nfl/team/_/name/ne/new-england-patriots). Under Rees, once a college quarterback himself, Milroe has grown into one of the best quarterbacks in college football. After struggling at the beginning of the season and losing the starting job against [South Florida](http://www.espn.com/college-football/team/_/id/58/south-florida-bulls), Milroe bounced back. As he led the Tide to 10 straight wins, an SEC title and a CFP berth, he also found a groove as both a runner and a passer, throwing for 2,718 yards and 23 touchdowns while running for 468 yards and 12 more scores. "When you look at me, you don't think I play quarterback," Milroe said. "You think I play [defensive back], linebacker, tight end. You don't think I play quarterback." When it comes to throwing the ball, Milroe takes pride in bucking conventional wisdom about himself and showing how effective of a thrower, not just a runner, he can be. As his confidence has grown, Milroe has only been affirmed in his belief that he can play the position at a high level, even if people such as O'Brien have doubted his ability to do so. "Growing up, I went to camp, they looked at me as a receiver or they saw me as not playing the quarterback position," Milroe said. "I beat all odds by playing quarterback, and that is something that I try to do as much as possible." Milroe acknowledged the uniqueness of his journey to this position, but he said he never wavered on his belief and desire that he had to be an SEC quarterback after committing to Alabama. Now, with Rees, Milroe has found a kindred spirit in a fellow quarterback who went through his own share of ups and downs. "This is the first time I had an OC that played the position," Milroe said. "I think I'm very receptive of his coaching because he played the position, played at a high level at [Notre Dame](http://www.espn.com/college-football/team/_/id/87/notre-dame-fighting-irish). And then now that he's coaching, he's able to coach the position and I'm able to absorb it as much as possible. So it's been great." Said Rees of Milroe: "He's an unbelievable kid. The way he is able to face adversity, the way he's able to push through things." The rest of the Tide's offense has also rallied around Milroe this season, touting his development as a leader as well. "Honestly, from the first game to all the way to now, he's looked like two different players, but it's the same person," wide receiver [Isaiah Bond](http://www.espn.com/college-football/player/_/id/4808839/isaiah-bond) said. "Confidence is a big role on the football field. If you don't have no trust, no confidence, you're not going to even play to your full potential. So believe in yourself is the main key part, and he's done that."

author: 中央通訊社
title: 屏東山區撤離481人 周春米晚間赴收容所送熱食
text:
屏東山區撤離481人 周春米晚間赴收容所送熱食
2025/7/10 23:02（7/10 23:16 更新）
（中央社記者李卉婷屏東縣10日電）屏東受到低壓帶及西南風影響，大雨不斷，屏東縣長周春米參訪北歐今天返台後，傍晚陸續趕往災害應變中心聽取簡報，隨後前往瑪家鄉收容所慰問安置民眾，送熱食關懷。
屏東縣政府今天新聞稿表示，周春米傍晚至災害應變中心聽取簡報掌握防災狀況，與團隊研判山區因連續豪大雨，土質鬆動、邊坡不穩，恐有致災之虞，決定霧台、三地門、瑪家、來義、泰武、春日、獅子、牡丹、滿州等9個鄉，明天仍停止上班、停止上課。
周春米隨後趕往瑪家鄉收容所慰問安置的部落居民，並分送豆漿及饅頭等熱食。周春米說，瑪家鄉今天下雨量達500毫米，2天累積雨量超過800毫米，感謝族人配合撤離安置，提供最新式防災帳棚，每家戶可以保有隱私，讓族人可以安心休息，希望族人在豪雨過後確認安全再返家。
截至晚上9時55分，三地門、瑪家、來義、獅子、滿州等鄉，共撤離481名民眾，其中370人依親、111人安置。
另外，農業部已公告屏東縣農業天然災害救助，包括全縣木瓜、香蕉、苦瓜、胡瓜及恆春鎮大豆等品項，縣府提醒農民盡快向所在地鄉鎮公所申報。（編輯：陳清芳）1140710

author: RandySF
title: Queens community board divided over issue of fluoride in drinking water
text: The issue of fluoride in drinking water is dividing a community board in Queens as it debates whether to pressure city and state officials to remove the chemical from New York City’s water system. Community Board 1 – which covers all of Astoria, parts of Long Island City and Woodside – considered a motion at its monthly meeting this week that would ask elected leaders in a letter to petition the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency for the removal of fluoride from drinking water. Leaving aside the scientific nuance of the debate, some members expressed skepticism over whether a local community board should be weighing in. Antonella Di Saverio, the board's environmental and sanitation committee chair, cited a California federal judge’s ruling from September that ordered the EPA to strengthen its regulations. “The impetus behind the letter is to raise awareness that a judge — as a result of the seven-year court case — thinks that we should be concerned with the levels of fluoride in water,” Di Saverio said. https://gothamist.com/news/queens-community-board-divided-over-issue-of-fluoride-in-drinking-water
